page.title: 12Downpatrick-Bezons Twinning
page.content: Downpatrick was twinned with{Bezons,}a {}town seven miles from Paris.This twinning is of benefit to clubs,societies,businesses and tourism.Such visits provide an exchange of ideas between the communities.School children also benefit by hearing the living language in its own environment. A group of twenty plus pupils from four of the five secondary/grammar schools have already been on a two- week visit to{Henri Wallon}school in Bezons and a group of Bezons children have made a return visit to the Downpatrick area. The practice of Twinning began after the Second World War to minimise the risk of renewed conflict. It is hoped that future exchange visits will take place. Bernard Mc Kinney,Teacher.
